isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - CONTROLS - REMOVAL

svcprocinfo.para: The following control components are mounted either on the pedestal in the cab, or on the control panel at the rear of the cab. For pedestal mounted controls, disassemble the pedestal as needed to gain access to the components being removed.

step1.para: Disconnect the air line from the rear of the gauge.
From the rear of the gauge, loosen the two screws that secure the hold down ring.
Turn the hold down ring so that the slots align with the gauge body. Remove the gauge body from the control panel.
Separate the air line fitting from the defective gauge for transfer to the replacement gauge.
Disconnect (and label) the air lines from the rear of the regulator.
Remove the knob from the regulator.
Remove the large mounting nut securing the regulator to the control panel.
Remove the regulator from the control panel.
Separate the air line fittings from the defective regulator for transfer to the replacement regulator.

After gaining access to the rear of the control panel, unplug the connector from the rear of the switch being removed by squeezing the locking tabs on the ends of the connector while pulling it straight off.
While squeezing the locking tabs on the top and bottom of the switch, push the switch through the control panel, to the front.
After gaining access to the rear of the control panel, unplug the relay from the relay connector mounted to the rear of the control panel.
